title: HELP PLS my account got hacked?
body: Someone has hacked  into either my account or the servers and changed my name to daffykunt it was previously Johnson81 I had played just the day before and my name was per usual. I don't knot how they changed it as there is no left over RP in my account which there would have been if they purchased RP to change my name (as the 1300 RP it costs to change summoner name is not an exact amount purchasable on the shop) and I had nowhere near enough to change it through IP pls help. is it possibe to change it back without paying? am I the only one this happened to?

replies.body:
Read over [this page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751694). It has all the information you need in regards to what you should do if you think your account has been hi-jacked.

You should also change the password to all of your other accounts, just to be safe. If not all, then at least the ones you accessed on the computer you use to play League.

The quicker you act, the better chance that they will still have an older backup of your account on their servers.

If you need any further help, just ask.

My account sorta got hacked but not hijacked someone has just changed my name but I still have full access to the account I was just wondering if it was possible for a riot employee or server mod or something to change the name back. im still confused as to how he/she did it tho because as I said in my original post there is no left over rp which there would have been if they had used purchased rp to change it and I didn't have enough ip to do it. is it possible they hacked the servers rather than my account? and is the name change back possible? tyvm for your time and help

>is it possible they hacked the servers rather than my account?

Comparing hacking into an account and hacking into a server...

They just aren't on the same level. It's possible, but they are miles apart in terms of difficulty. Also, if you hacked into a server, why would you only mess up one guy's account? And in such a weird way, too.

The terminology "hi-jacked account" basically means that someone other than you, and whom you have not authorised, has access to your account. Most people who get access to another person's account without their permission will usually change the password (because they have the e-mail as well, in most cases). Just because you still have access to your own account, it still falls under this category.

Ultimately, you'll need to submit a support ticket in order to get what you want. They will instruct you on what you need to provide.

Be sure to change the password for every account you have access to on your computer, not just League.
